Miracle 9721 - Horn of the Insect God
Operator of Miracle: Spore Class of Miracle: Artifact Location: Artifact Compartment, Biomatery Subcompartment
The immediate biological part of Contemplator Yankhen. One of his two horns, consisting of highly durable "divine" chitin, is fragile, broken at the base, but has retained its integrity due to its remarkable resilience.
The study of his horn helped us get closer to unraveling the structure of the organism not only of Yankhen himself, whose appearance resembled a cross between an anthropomorphic humanoid and a beetle, but also of many other Contemplators. It was only after obtaining real proof of existence of biological components in Contemplators, after many years of research not only by us but by the entire scientific community of Alseer's Sleep, that we were able to equate Contemplators with living organisms. Hypotheses about gods of our universe being organic beings have been discussed for a long time, but we had no direct evidence other than presence of functional blood, the Truth, in them.
The study of Broken Horn also allowed us to study aging processes in Contemplators. It is well known that Yankhen was the first deity born of Primordial Mother Alseer, making him the first Contemplator ever to appear. Apparently, Yankhen's horns grew throughout his life - about seven hundred years - which suggests that the "only mortal" concept of aging is not foreign even to gods. This is also confirmed by fact that at the beginning of life of Insect God in the Time of the Unbridled Flame, according to eyewitnesses in the form of Cynics, his horns were much smaller, and he himself looked much younger than at the time of his death.
The Broken Horn is imbued with a small amount of Yankhen's residual energy, but despite its small volume, it is enough for lower termites from Point Zero, thanks to their instincts and desire to be as close as possible to their god, to sense him and fly to him across many light years. This feature of Broken Horn forced us to isolate it from other artifacts in a special container that absorbs its residual power and prevents termites from knowing where the artifact is currently located. Although they seem to know that their god has long since perished, they still cannot overcome their natural desire to follow him - even a small part of him.
As we mentioned earlier, this Miracle is made of highly durable chitin. Studying it allowed us to learn composition of Insect God's armor and how the Flame of War did not harm him, even though everything around him was burning during the incident in the Realm of Cynics. It turns out that Yankhen's chitin is so heat-resistant that it can withstand even the most extreme temperatures. For example, if you put it in the core of a blue giant star, not only would it not be damaged, but it would also harden even more, strengthening its protective properties for a while. However, chitin itself is very fragile, and this is probably why Yankhen's horn broke off so easily from his head when he died.
It can be assumed that if Contemplators are indeed not very different from living organisms, they must also have concept of heredity. Nevertheless, the direct daughter of Insect God named Dawn (now Aurora) did not have biological chitin and had no horns at all, and despite her father's highly protected body, she had no protection at all. Moreover, apart from her great love for Lepidoptera, she had no connection to insects. One might also assume that she took after her mother, Dreamer, but in that case, she should have possessed at least some of her powers, which she never had. This proves that organism of Contemplators and many of processes taking place within it are still subject to detailed study. We know too little about gods who created and developed our worlds and with whom we have direct connections.
